1.verse: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,

2.verse: to the saints and faithful brothers in Christ at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father.

3.verse: We always thank God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, when we pray for you,

4.verse: for we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and the love that you have for all the saints.

5.verse: Both spring from the hope laid up for you in heaven. Of this you have heard before in the word of truth, the gospel,

6.verse: which has come to you. Just as in the entire world it is bearing fruit and growing, so also is it among you from the day you heard it and understood the grace of God in truth;

7.verse: just as you learned it from Epaphras our beloved fellow servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf

8.verse: and has told us of your love in the Spirit.

9.verse: For this reason, from the day we heard about you, we have not ceased praying for you and asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,

10.verse: that you may walk worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing to him, bearing fruit in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God,

11.verse: being strengthened with all power according to his glorious might, for the display of all endurance and patience; while joyfully

12.verse: giving thanks to the Father, who has qualified you to share in the inheritance of the saints in the light.

13.verse: He has rescued us from the tyranny of darkness and transferred us into the kingdom of his beloved Son,

14.verse: in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.

15.verse: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation;

16.verse: for in him all things were created, in heaven and on earth, things visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions, whether principalities or powers—all things have been created through him and for him.

17.verse: And he is before all things, and in him all things hold together.

18.verse: And he is the head of the body, the church. He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, in order that he might be preeminent in everything.

19.verse: For God was pleased to have all his fullness dwell in him,

20.verse: and through him to reconcile all things to himself, whether on earth or in heaven, by making peace through his blood shed on the cross.

21.verse: And you who were at one time alienated and hostile in mind, doing evil deeds,

22.verse: he has now reconciled in Christ’s physical body through his death, in order to present you holy, without blemish and beyond reproach in his sight—

23.verse: if indeed you continue in the faith, stable and steadfast, not shifting from the hope of the gospel that you heard, which has been proclaimed to every creature under heaven, and of which I, Paul, became a minister.

24.verse: I am now rejoicing in my sufferings on your behalf, and in my flesh am completing what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ for the sake of his body, which is the church,

25.verse: of which I became a minister according to the stewardship from God that was given to me for your benefit, to make the word of God fully known,

26.verse: the mystery that has been hidden for ages and generations, but has now been revealed to his saints.

27.verse: To them God chose to make known how great among the Gentiles are the glorious riches of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.

28.verse: He is the one we proclaim, warning everyone and teaching everyone with all wisdom, so that we may present everyone mature in Christ.

29.verse: To this end I labor, striving according to his power that works powerfully in me.

1.verse: For I want you to know how great a struggle I have for you and for those in Laodicea and for all who have not seen my face in the flesh.

2.verse: My goal is that their hearts may be encouraged and knit together in love, so that they may have all the wealth of full assurance of understanding, for knowledge of God’s mystery, which is Christ,

3.verse: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

4.verse: I am telling you this so that no one may deceive you with specious arguments.

5.verse: Even though I am absent in body, I am with you in spirit, and I rejoice to see your orderly conduct and the stability of your faith in Christ.

6.verse: So then, just as you received Christ Jesus as Lord, continue to live in him,

7.verse: rooted and built up in him, established in the faith just as you were taught, and abounding in thanksgiving.

8.verse: See to it that no one takes you captive by means of philosophy and empty deceit, according to the tradition of men, according to the elemental spirits of the world, and not according to Christ.

9.verse: For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells in bodily form,

10.verse: and you have come to fullness in him, who is the head of every principality and power.

11.verse: In him you also were circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands, by the putting off of the body of flesh, by the circumcision of Christ.

12.verse: Having been buried with him in baptism, you have also been raised with him through faith in the powerful working of God, who raised him from the dead.

13.verse: And although you were dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made you alive with Christ. He forgave us all our transgressions,

14.verse: having canceled the certificate of debt with its legal demands against us, which was hostile to us. He has taken it away by nailing it to the cross.

15.verse: He stripped the principalities and powers of their authority and disgraced them in public by triumphing over them in Christ.

16.verse: Therefore do not let anyone judge you with respect to food and drink, or in regard to a religious festival, a new moon, or a Sabbath day.

17.verse: These are but a shadow of what was to come, but the reality is found in Christ.

18.verse: Let no one rob you of your prize, insisting on self-abasement and the worship of angels, taking his stand on visions, puffed up with empty notions by his earthly way of thinking.

19.verse: That person is not holding fast to the head, from whom the whole body, nourished and held together by its joints and ligaments, grows with a growth that is from God.

20.verse: Since you died with Christ to the elemental spirits of the world, why, as though you were still living in the world, do you submit to regulations such as,

21.verse: “Do not handle! Do not taste! Do not touch!”?

22.verse: These are all destined to perish with use, based as they are on human commands and teachings.

23.verse: Such regulations indeed have the appearance of wisdom with their self-imposed religious piety, false humility, and harsh control over the body, but they are of no value against the gratification of the flesh.

1.verse: Therefore if you have been raised with Christ, seek the things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God.

2.verse: Set your minds on things above, not on things on earth,

3.verse: for you died and your life is hidden with Christ in God.

4.verse: When Christ, who is your life, appears, then you also will appear with him in glory.

5.verse: Therefore put to death whatever is earthly in you: sexual immorality, impurity, lust, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry.

6.verse: Because of these, the wrath of God is coming upon the sons of disobedience.

7.verse: And in them you also once walked, when you were living among them.

8.verse: But now you must put away all those things: anger, rage, malice, slander, and filthy talk from your mouth.

9.verse: Stop lying to one another, since you have put off the old man with its practices,

10.verse: and have put on the new man, which is being renewed in knowledge after the image of its creator.

11.verse: Here there is no longer Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave and free, but Christ is all and in all.

12.verse: Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with heartfelt compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.

13.verse: Bear with one another and forgive each another, should anyone have a complaint against another. As the Lord has graciously forgiven you, so also you must forgive.

14.verse: And cover all these virtues with love, which is the bond that leads to perfection.

15.verse: And let the peace of Christ be the ruling principle in your heart, to which indeed you were called in one body. And be thankful.

16.verse: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom by means of psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with gratitude in your heart to God.

17.verse: And whatever you do in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

18.verse: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

19.verse: Husbands, love your wives and do not become bitter toward them.

20.verse: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is pleasing in the Lord.

21.verse: Fathers, do not provoke your children, lest they become discouraged.

22.verse: Slaves, obey your earthly masters in every regard, not with a view to impressing others, as people-pleasers, but with sincerity of heart, fearing the Lord.

23.verse: Whatever you do, do it heartily, as for the Lord, not for men,

24.verse: for you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as your reward. Serve the Lord Christ.

25.verse: But the one who does wrong will be paid back for his wrong, and there is no favoritism.

1.verse: Masters, treat your slaves justly and fairly, knowing that you too have a Master in heaven.

2.verse: Persevere in prayer, being vigilant in it with thanksgiving.

3.verse: At the same time, pray also for us, that God will open a door for our message, so that we may declare the mystery of Christ, for which I am in chains;

4.verse: that I may make it known as I should.

5.verse: Conduct yourselves with wisdom toward outsiders, making the most of the time.

6.verse: Your speech should always be winsome, seasoned with salt, so that you will know how you must answer each person.

7.verse: Tychicus, a beloved brother, faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.

8.verse: I am sending him to you for this express purpose, that you may know how we are and that he may encourage your hearts.

9.verse: With him is Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you; they will tell you about everything here.

10.verse: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends you greetings, as does Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (about whom you received instructions; if he comes to you, welcome him),

11.verse: and Jesus who is called Justus. These are the only Jewish Christians among my fellow workers for the kingdom of God, and they have been a comfort to me.

12.verse: Epaphras, who is one of you and a servant of Christ Jesus, sends you greetings, always laboring on your behalf in his prayers, that you may stand firm in everything that God wills, mature and fully assured.

13.verse: For I bear him witness that he has worked tirelessly for you and for those in Laodicea and in Hierapolis.

14.verse: Our dear friend Luke, the physician, sends you his greetings, as does Demas.

15.verse: Give my greetings to the brothers who are at Laodicea as well as to Nympha and the church that meets in her house.

16.verse: And after this letter has been read among you, see that it is read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and that you read the one from Laodicea as well.

17.verse: And tell Archippus, “See to it that you complete the ministry that you have received in the Lord.”

18.verse: I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you.
